item.title: 欧洲央行尚未关闭十月降息的大门
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，欧洲央行理事会成员还不能排除在 10 月 17 日的下一次决策中降息的可能性，即使降息的可能性不大。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council members aren’t yet in a position to rule out an interest-rate cut at their next decision on Oct. 17 even if such a move is unlikely, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织官员因与米莱伊不和而退出阿根廷会谈
item.description: 国际货币基金组织与阿根廷的最高谈判代表在招致阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）的愤怒后，已将与这个南美国家的会谈委托给同事进行。【原文：The International Monetary Fund’s top negotiator with Argentina has delegated talks with the South American nation to colleagues after drawing the ire of President Javier Milei.】

item.title: 美国财政年度即将结束，预算缺口达 1.9 万亿美元
item.description: 美国联邦预算赤字在 8 月份激增，距离本财政年度结束还有一个月的时间，因为利息成本上升继续拖累总体收支平衡。【原文：The US federal budget deficit surged in August with one month to go until the end of the fiscal year as higher interest costs continued to weigh on the overall balance.】

item.title: 丹麦央行降息四分之一个百分点，与欧洲央行看齐
item.description: 丹麦央行降息四分之一个百分点，与欧元区央行看齐，捍卫克朗与共同货币挂钩的地位。【原文：Denmark’s central bank delivered a quarter-point interest-rate cut to match its euro-area counterpart and defend the krone’s peg to the common currency.】

item.title: 旧金山一座耗资 10 亿美元的大厦因诉讼案而蒙上阴影
item.description: 旧金山最具标志性的建筑之一在历时四年、耗资 2.5 亿美元的改造后重新开业，这标志着这座城市的复兴。但它的重新开业却是在其主要租户之一提起诉讼的阴影下进行的。【原文：One of San Francisco’s most iconic buildings is celebrating its reopening after a four-year, $250 million makeover meant to symbolize the city’s renewal. It’s doing so under the shadow of a lawsuit from one of its key tenants.】

item.title: 交易平台 eToro 与美国证券交易委员会达成和解，限制美国加密货币活动
item.description: EToro USA LLC 同意支付 150 万美元，并只允许美国客户在其平台上交易少数加密货币，以了结美国证券交易委员会对其作为未注册经纪商和清算机构运营的指控。【原文：EToro USA LLC agreed to pay $1.5 million and allow American customers to only trade only a handful of cryptocurrencies on its platform to settle US Securities and Exchange Commission allegations that it operated as an unregistered broker and clearing agency.】

item.title: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司的詹恩出售了超过一半的 A 类股票
item.description: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司负责保险业务的副董事长 Ajit Jain 出售了其持有的价值 1.39 亿美元的巴菲特企业集团 A 类股。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway Inc.’s vice chair of insurance operations, Ajit Jain, sold $139 million worth of his Class A shares in Warren Buffett’s conglomerate.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德称部分人欢迎奥塞勒收购德国商业银行
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）和德国商业银行（Commerzbank）之间的合作将受到那些一直呼吁加强欧元区金融业一体化的人们的欢迎。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said that a tie-up between Italy’s UniCredit SpA and Germany’s Commerzbank would be welcomed by those who’ve been calling for greater integration in the euro area’s financial sector.】

item.title: 亚洲市场萎缩，英国航空加倍发力利润丰厚的美国市场
item.description: 明年夏天，英国航空公司将提供创纪录数量的飞往北美的航班，因为该航空公司将加倍努力开拓其最赚钱的市场。【原文：British Airways will offer a record number of flights to North America next summer as the carrier doubles down on its most profitable market.】

item.title: 大型对冲基金缩减资产，Point72 计划返还数十亿美元
item.description: 亿万富翁史蒂夫-科恩（Steve Cohen）的 Point72 资产管理公司正准备首次向投资者返还部分资金，加入多行政对冲基金同行的行列，在经历一段爆炸式增长后寻找限制资产的方法。【原文：Billionaire Steve Cohen’s Point72 Asset Management is preparing to return some capital to investors for the first time, joining multistrategy hedge fund peers looking for ways to restrict their assets after a period of explosive growth.】

item.title: Verizon 将每季度计提高达 19 亿美元的离职费用
item.description: Verizon Communications Inc. 第三季度将因裁员 4,800 人而产生高达 19 亿美元的税前费用。【原文：Verizon Communications Inc. will take a pre-tax charge of as much as $1.9 billion in the third quarter tied to 4,800 planned job cuts.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行就供过于求发出警告，美光遭遇罕见熊市呼声
item.description: 由于法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas Exane）警告称，美光科技公司（Micron Technology Inc.【原文：Micron Technology Inc. shares tumbled on Thursday, with the maker of computer memory chips extending a recent selloff as BNP Paribas Exane warned that the stock would continue to underperform others connected to artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 乌克兰称俄罗斯袭击船只后小麦创两个月新高
item.description: 在乌克兰称俄罗斯用导弹袭击了一艘粮船后，小麦期货跳涨了2.2%。【原文：Wheat futures jumped as much as 2.2% after Ukraine said Russia hit a grain ship with a missile.】

item.title: 灰度公司为第七大加密代币提供信任，XRP 随之上涨
item.description: 加密资产管理公司灰度投资公司（Grayscale Investments）表示，它已开始发售灰度 XRP 信托基金（Grayscale XRP Trust），帮助第七大数字资产的价格上涨了近 10%。【原文：Crypto asset manager Grayscale Investments said it has begun to offer the Grayscale XRP Trust, helping to send the price of the seventh-largest digital asset up by almost 10%.】

item.title: Revolut 首席执行官在八月的股票销售中抛售了约 2.5 亿美元的股票
item.description: Revolut 有限公司首席执行官尼-斯托伦斯基（Nik Storonsky）在上个月的二次股票出售中出售了其持有的价值约 2.5 亿美元的股份，该公司的估值为 450 亿美元。【原文：Revolut Ltd.’s Chief Executive Officer Nik Storonsky sold about $250 million worth of his stake in the company during a secondary share sale that valued the company at $45 billion last month.】

item.title: CFPB 禁止 Navient 提供联邦学生贷款服务并处以罚款
item.description: 根据与消费者金融保护局（Consumer Financial Protection Bureau）达成的和解协议，Navient 公司将被禁止为联邦学生贷款提供服务，并必须支付 1.2 亿美元。【原文：Navient Corp. will be banned from servicing federal student loans and must pay $120 million under a proposed settlement with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.】

item.title: 加密货币基金 ParaFi 将风险投资基金的权益代币化
item.description: ParaFi Capital 是一家总部位于纽约的数字资产管理公司，其支持者包括 KKR & Co.公司的联合创始人亨利-克拉维斯（Henry Kravis）。【原文：ParaFi Capital, a New York-based digital asset manager that includes KKR & Co. co-founder Henry Kravis among its backers, is tokenizing a minority portion of its latest venture-capital fund, which closed in May.】

item.title: 杠杆 ETF 基金规模达创纪录的 1 170 亿美元，波动性难辞其咎
item.description: 在经历了几周令人反胃的波动之后，华尔街的专家们将加剧股市波动的原因归咎于一种新兴的杠杆投资策略，尤其是在交易日结束之前。【原文：After weeks of stomach-churning volatility, Wall Street pundits are blaming a burgeoning leveraged investment strategy for exacerbating stock-market moves, particularly right before the end of the trading day.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦期待国际货币基金组织本月审查 70 亿美元新贷款
item.description: 巴基斯坦预计国际货币基金组织执行董事会将于本月对其新的 70 亿美元贷款计划进行审查，在此之前，该计划的推迟曾引起投资者的担忧。【原文：Pakistan expects the International Monetary Fund’s executive board to review its new $7 billion loan program this month after a delay raised investor concerns.】

item.title: 微软正在调查 Azure、365 服务的访问问题
item.description: 微软公司正在调查可能发生的故障，称用户可能无法从 AT&T 公司的网络访问其服务。【原文：Microsoft Corp. is investigating a possible outage, saying users may be unable to access its services from AT&T Inc. networks.】

item.title: 泽连斯基称俄罗斯导弹击中中立水域的谷物船
item.description: 俄罗斯总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基在 Telegram 上说，俄罗斯在一艘粮船周四离开乌克兰水域后立即用导弹击中了这艘船。【原文：Russia hit a grain ship with a missile immediately after it left Ukrainian waters on Thursday, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Telegram.】

item.title: 私募股权公司将成为韩国锌业最大股东
item.description: MBK Partners 签署了一项协议，使该私募股权公司成为全球最大的精炼锌和铅生产商韩国锌业公司（Korea Zinc Co.【原文：MBK Partners signed a deal that would make the private equity firm the largest shareholder in Korea Zinc Co., the world’s biggest producer of refined zinc and lead.】

item.title: Tennet 在德国棘手的私有化过程中寻求首次公开募股（IPO）机会
item.description: 荷兰电网运营商 Tennet Holding BV 最近几个月未能将其庞大的德国电网出售给柏林，该公司正在推进将其私有化的计划，这可能又是一场艰苦的战斗。【原文：Tennet Holding BV, the Dutch grid operator that failed to sell its massive German grid to Berlin in recent months, is pushing ahead with plans to privatize the unit in what could prove to be another uphill battle.】

item.title: 习近平敦促在质疑声中努力实现年度增长目标
item.description: 中国国家主席习近平呼吁各级政府官员实现国家的年度增长目标，因为经济学家对这个世界第二大经济体的发展势头表示怀疑。【原文：Chinese President Xi Jinping called on government officials at all levels to achieve the country’s annual growth target, as economists have cast doubt over momentum in the world’s second largest economy.】

item.title: 据称美的集团有望在香港上市融资 40 亿美元
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，中国家电巨头美的集团股份有限公司（Midea Group Co.【原文：Chinese appliance giant Midea Group Co. is poised to raise $4 billion in its Hong Kong listing in an enlarged deal that will be priced at the top of the marketed range, people familiar with the matter said, in a show of demand for the city’s biggest share sale in three years.】

item.title: 美国监管机构调查 VinFast 汽车报告的安全问题
item.description: 美国监管机构对越南 VinFast 汽车有限公司生产的一些电动汽车的安全问题展开了初步调查。【原文：A US regulator has opened a preliminary investigation into some electric vehicles manufactured by Vietnam’s VinFast Auto Ltd. over a safety issue.】

item.title: 美国生产者价格下调后略有回升
item.description: 美国 8 月份的生产者价格在上月数据下调后略有回升，这进一步证明通胀压力正在减缓。【原文：US producer prices picked up slightly in August after the previous month’s numbers were revised lower, adding to evidence that inflationary pressures are moderating.】

item.title: 津巴布韦中央银行行长计划打击黄金支持货币破坏者
item.description: 津巴布韦中央银行誓言将 "加倍努力 "打击货币破坏者，该行指责是他们煽动了该国以金银为支持的货币单位在平行市场上的下跌。【原文：Zimbabwe’s central bank vowed to “double efforts” against currency saboteurs it blames for fanning the decline of the nation’s bullion-backed unit on the parallel market.】

item.title: 拉扎德策略师称特朗普关税威胁对股市不利
item.description: 据一位拉扎德（Lazard）策略师称，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）计划对外国生产的商品全面征收关税，这很可能会再次引发高通胀和美国经济低增长的风险，从而对股市构成威胁。【原文：Donald Trump’s plans to impose sweeping tariffs on foreign-produced goods are likely to reignite the risk of high inflation and low US economic growth, posing a threat to stocks, according to a Lazard strategist.】

item.title: 政府镇压结束后，中国科技为何没有反弹？
item.description: 中国花了两年多的时间来整顿国内最强大的私营科技公司，包括阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司、腾讯控股有限公司和滴滴出行公司，以及这些公司极其富有的创始人。【原文：China spent the better part of two years reining in the country’s most powerful private technology companies, including Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., Tencent Holdings Ltd. and Didi Global Inc., along with their ultra-rich founders.】
